I spent so long on that feraligatr drawing out each scale by hand. A crocodile anatomy design understanding base I still pull from to this day. Also thought I was so clever to combine hippo anatomy with crocs only to discover mahajangasuchus already existed.

from 2013

After a three month break I came back with the beginning of "season 2". Though the anatomy is kinda dogshit now I really learned a lot doing the fossils for aerodactyl while marathoning Kitchen Nightmares. 

from 2013

Its crazy how many of these I pumped out so fast back then. The groudon was the last in "season 1" which was only done 5 months after starting the whole thing. A pace of output I'd never again achieve as my work became more complicated and detailed.

from 2012/2013

The gengar piece was actually done over the course of one 21 hour livestream, still my longest stream. Ultimately my most divisive in this series but also probably my most clever design solution with the gastly eyes as bat ears haha

from 2012

Its weird looking back that I didnt actually start with these guys but I'm glad I didnt because it allowed me time to develop the idea of what I was trying to say. These were huge breakthroughs for me and honestly are kind of the key to understanding my creature design ideology.

from 2012
been here since april actually haha

I still fondly remember a comment on my nidoking from an artist I very much admired where he spoke about how I was good at conveying personality in creatures. Thats something I've been very mindful of in the decade since.

from 2012

New platform means new excuse to repost my old Realistic Pokemon series. This is a master thread with every one of them in the order they were made.

Experimenting with some workflow ideas: 

1) Lines with hue jitter set to per stroke
2) Sharpen tool to really grain up texture to imply detail
3) Shadows: inner glow(multiply) with low fill 
4) Light: hard light layer with outer glow(overlay) 
5) Mixer brush on top
Testing out some pens and markers. It’s been a number of years since I last regularly drew in a sketchbook, I’d like to do that more again.
